item.title: Report E-2023100258
item.description:
Report E-2023100258

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-12T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: GRAND PRAIRIE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER FREIGHT SYSTEMS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 10, 2023, at 0337 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Grand Prairie, Texas from their terminal DLS, regarding the release of approximately (1.5) gallons of Penguin Cement 321LH Adhesive (UN1133, 3, II) from (2) 1-gallon metal drums. Onsite personnel reported that they conducted all clean up operations and the waste is staged on site pending proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023100362
item.description:
Report X-2023100362

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-18T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 09/14/2023 at approximately 1300, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 147179 at the hub facility in Fort Worth, reporting a damaged package incident. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box containing one cellular phone, for which the shiiper utilize the packaging exemption. The package reportedly became lodged in the gears of the conveyor belt, resulting in extensive damage to the package and the inner contents. The shipment will be set for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023100359
item.description:
Report X-2023100359

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-18T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Sept 15th during the AM sort a package was found that was leaking most of its contents. The package contained UN1267, Petroleum Crude Oil, 3, II. It appears that the lid came off of the can inside allowing the contents to leak out. The package was placed into a salvage drum and the shipper will be contacted for disposition..

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was segregated to prevent damage occurring to other packages.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on load side of hub contained in a plastic bag. Outer box was wet all over. DescribePack: Upon inspection, one of the four plastic bottles inside of the box was missing its cap and was empty. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was not spreading. Box was placed into a salvage drum prior to being transported to the Hazmat processing area.

item.title: Report I-2023090158
item.description:
Report I-2023090158

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-17T15:12:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: Laredo
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CONTRACT FREIGHTERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A van trailer containing pallets of adhesives was to be unloaded. The doors were opened and it was determined that several 5-gallon pails had fallen during transportation and released some of the contents. An environmental company was dispatched to remediate the spill. Upon inspection, two 5-gallon pails had released from one to two gallons of adhesive each. The two adhesive pails were placed into a 55-gallon salvage drum. The impacted stretch wrap was also placed into the salvage drum. The remaining pails were undamaged and were restacked and stretch wrapped.

item.title: Report X-2023090851
item.description:
Report X-2023090851

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-17T15:12:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was damaged during loading of a truck on van line 6 on pre-load. When package was inspected, there was nothing separating the two glass jars. One was broken and had spilled everywhere in the box and onto the other container that was lying in the potassium permanganate. DescribePack: The package failed because there was nothing separating two glass jars from each other that and making sure you are using the proper loading techniques while loading a hazmat. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Thankfully it did not smell, but it was moved to the hazmat cage. Bay doors and fans were on.

item.title: Report E-2023100407
item.description:
Report E-2023100407

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-16T18:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: WEATHERFORD
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Prior driver delivered before this driver into tanks 4 and 5 and the vents are all manifold together. Driver checked QT app before loading at the rack and dialed back the loaded gallons from 8000 to 7500. Driver pulled up to store and completed paper work and veeder root reading. Driver put cones out. Driver stick the tanks to confirm the stick readings were 2 inches under the veeder root reading. Driver loaded 3 compartments into tank 6 with no issues. Driver loaded last compartment into tank 7. Compartment started to slow down on unloading, driver shut external valve and kept internal open. Driver cleared product hose and moved it back to tank 6. Product started to over flow out of tank 7.

item.title: Report E-2023100342
item.description:
Report E-2023100342

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-14T00:31:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 29, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3265 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) cups of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed soda ash and absorbents to the UN3265-impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon super sack. LSH personnel patched and placed the damaged 55-gallon drum of product into one (1) 95-gallon drum.
